definition: to withdraw/to leave/to retreat/to pull out

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.chinese: 所有人员均撤出危险区。

sentences.english: As the enemy retreated, we were ordered to disengage.
sentences.chinese: 当敌人退却时我们受命撤出战斗。

sentences.english: So, those are the reasons predominantly why people cannot get out themselves.
sentences.chinese: 这就是人们为什么无法从利比亚撤出的主要原因。

sentences.english: The fire blazed away and destroyed the whole hotel.
sentences.chinese: 燃烧着的旅馆中撤出来。

sentences.english: Either put in enough firemen to put the fire out or get out of the house.
sentences.chinese: 不派足消防员将火灭掉，那就让他们撤出那房子。

sentences.english: In recent years, Israel withdrew from South Lebanon and Gaza.
sentences.chinese: 近些年里，以色列从南黎巴嫩和加沙撤出。

sentences.english: That was the reason for withdrawing from East of Suez in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 那就是当初撤出苏伊士以东的最首要的原因。

sentences.english: They demanded that all the aggressor troops be pulled out from their country.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求所有侵略军都应撤出他们的国家。

sentences.english: But even a gradual pullback could have big repercussions.
sentences.chinese: 但即便是逐步撤出也会产生重大影响。

sentences.english: The fireman evacuated the guests from the burning hotel.
sentences.chinese: 消防队员把客人们从燃烧着的旅馆中撤出来。

sentences.english: The day before finalizing the investment, the customer announced that they were backing out.
sentences.chinese: 在最终确定投资那天，那个客户宣布他们将撤出。

sentences.english: As soon as you hear the fire alarm you need to clear out of the building as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 当你听到警报的时候，你必须尽快从楼里撤出来。

sentences.english: The sergeant was injures and so the corporal took the initiative and lead the platoon out of the danger area.
sentences.chinese: 中士受伤了，因此下士主动带领全排撤出了危险区。

sentences.english: The act or an instance of vacating.
sentences.chinese: 空出，撤出，辞去辞职的行为或实例。

sentences.english: President Nicolas Sarkozy has said all French troops will be withdrawn from Afghanistan by 2014.
sentences.chinese: 总统萨科齐说道所有法国部队将会在2014年撤出。

sentences.english: The peace-preserving army of the United Nations pulled out of the area.
sentences.chinese: 联合国的维和部队撤出了那个地区。

definition: to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to return (an item)/to send back/to go back
to give up defending/to yield/to surrender
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to go to war/to engage in war
to enter and garrison/(fig.) to establish a presence in
